content.description: Start on low crimpers and head for the obvious sloper to the top jugs
content.location: Follow the Hog Rock Nature Trail .2 miles from the Hog Rock Parking lot and come across an obvious boulder parked on the right.

content.description: Start on a small angular handhold with vertical left face- a few feet from the far left end of the boulder.  Begin traversing right through crimps to the obvious flat sloping feature.  Pop up to the rail, and work through a series of additional crimps on the larger face farther right.  End by exiting up and to the right of the perched rock feature on top of the boulder- up and over the farthest right corner of the wall.  Top of the wall is off for the entire traverse!
content.protection: Pad and a spotter or bring a couple on your own.
content.location: Easily accessible along the Hog Rock Overlook trail from the Blue Ridge Summit/Hog Rock parking area.  Only a short distance up a short incline from the lot.  It practically sits on the trail to the left- can't miss it.

content.description: Start at the honeycomb on the rail and work up right gaining the jugs
content.location: Right of Son of pigman on the obvious boulder next to the Hog Rock nature trail.

content.description: climb the good holds up and left out of the overhang of Hog Rock.
short overhanging problem. starts down low on the ledge and powers through the lip.
content.location: climbers right of Bosshog roof is a small boulder and this problem is in the center face.

content.description: Start on Boss Hog and head straight up directly out the overhang over the exposed drop off.
Start far left on a low jug rail. Move right as you make your way through the crimp rail out to the right side. followed by a tough foot cut and two tough lock-off moves.
content.location: right off the Hog Rock trail

content.description: Hog Rock is a point of interest along the Catoctin Mountain Park hiking trail.  It features numerous boulders along the approach and in all styles and sizes.
